00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 AppletObjects.pl - Macro-based front end for the Applet.pm module.
00020 
00021 
00022 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00023 
00024 This subroutines in this 
00025 file provide mechanisms to insert Flash applets (and  Java applets)
00026 into a WeBWorK problem.
00027 
00028 
00029 See also L<http://webwork.maa.org/pod/pg_TRUNK/lib/Applet.html>.
00030 
00031 =cut
00032 
00033 #########################################################################
00034 #
00035 # Add basic functionality to the header of the question
00036 #
00037 # don't reload this file
00038 #########################################################################
00039 
00040 sub _AppletObjects_init{ 
00041 
00042 main::HEADER_TEXT(<<'END_HEADER_TEXT');
00043   <script language="javascript">AC_FL_RunContent = 0;</script>
00044     <script src="/webwork2_files/applets/AC_RunActiveContent.js" language="javascript">
00045     </script>
00046     <script src="/webwork2_files/js/Base64.js" language="javascript">
00047     </script>   
00048     <script src="/webwork2_files/js/ww_applet_support.js" language="javascript">
00049         //upload functions stored in /opt/webwork/webwork2/htdocs/js ...
00050     </script>
00051 END_HEADER_TEXT
00052 
00053 };

00063 
00064 }

00096 =head1 Methods
00097 
00098 =cut
00099 
00100 ## this method is defined in this file 
00101 ## because the main subroutines HEADER_TEXT and MODES are 
00102 ## not available to the module FlashApplet when that file
00103 ## is compiled (at the time the apache child process is first initialized)
00104 
00105 =head3  insertAll
00106 
00107     Useage:   TEXT( $applet->insertAll() );
00108               \{ $applet->insertAll() \}     (used within BEGIN_TEXT/END_TEXT blocks)
00109 
00110 =cut 
00111 
00112 =pod 
00113 
00114 Inserts applet at this point in the HTML code.  (In TeX mode a message "Applet" is written.)  This method
00115 also adds the applets header material into the header portion of the HTML page. It effectively inserts
00116 the outputs of both C<$applet-E<gt>insertHeader> and C<$applet-E<gt>insertObject> (defined in L<Applet.pm> ) 
00117 in the appropriate places. In addition it creates a hidden answer blank for storing the state of the applet
00118 and provides mechanisms for revealing the state while debugging the applet.
00119 
00120 Note: This method is defined here rather than in Applet.pl because it 
00121       requires access to the RECORD_FORM_LABEL subroutine
00122       and to the routine accessing the stored values of the answers.  These are defined in main::.
00123       FIXME -- with the creation of the PGcore object this can now be rewritten
00124 
00125 =cut
00126 
00127 sub insertAll {  ## inserts both header text and object text
00128     my $self = shift;
00129     my %options = @_;
00130     
00131     
00132     ##########################
00133     # determine debug mode
00134     # debugMode can be turned on by setting it to 1 in either the applet definition or at insertAll time
00135     ##########################
00136 
00137     my $debugMode = (defined($options{debug}) and $options{debug}>0) ? $options{debug} : 0;
00138     my $includeAnswerBox = (defined($options{includeAnswerBox}) and $options{includeAnswerBox}==1) ? 1 : 0;
00139     $debugMode = $debugMode || $self->debugMode;
00140     $self->debugMode( $debugMode);
00141 
00142     
00143     my $reset_button = $options{reinitialize_button} || 0;
00144     warn qq! please change  "reset_button=>1" to "reinitialize_button=>1" in the applet->installAll() command \n! if defined($options{reset_button});
00145 
00146     ##########################
00147     # Get data to be interpolated into the HTML code defined in this subroutine
00148     #
00149     # This consists of the name of the applet and the names of the routines 
00150     # to get and set State of the applet (which is done every time the question page is refreshed
00151     # and to get and set Config  which is the initial configuration the applet is placed in 
00152     # when the question is first viewed.  It is also the state which is returned to when the 
00153     # reset button is pressed.
00154     ##########################
00155 
00156     # prepare html code for storing state 
00157     my $appletName      = $self->appletName;
00158     my $appletStateName = "${appletName}_state";   # the name of the hidden "answer" blank storing state FIXME -- use persistent data instead
00159     my $getState        = $self->getStateAlias;    # names of routines for this applet
00160     my $setState        = $self->setStateAlias;
00161     my $getConfig       = $self->getConfigAlias;
00162     my $setConfig       = $self->setConfigAlias;
00163 
00164     my $base64_initialState     = encode_base64($self->initialState);
00165     main::RECORD_FORM_LABEL($appletStateName);            #this insures that the state will be saved from one invocation to the next
00166                                                           # FIXME -- with PGcore the persistant data mechanism can be used instead
00167     my $answer_value = '';
00168 
00169     ##########################
00170     # implement the sticky answer mechanism for maintaining the applet state when the question page is refreshed
00171     # This is important for guest users for whom no permanent record of answers is recorded.
00172     ##########################
00173     
00174     if ( defined( ${$main::inputs_ref}{$appletStateName} ) and ${$main::inputs_ref}{$appletStateName} =~ /\S/ ) {   
00175         $answer_value = ${$main::inputs_ref}{$appletStateName};
00176     } elsif ( defined( $main::rh_sticky_answers->{$appletStateName} )  ) {
00177         warn "type of sticky answers is ", ref( $main::rh_sticky_answers->{$appletStateName} );
00178         $answer_value = shift( @{ $main::rh_sticky_answers->{$appletStateName} });
00179     }
00180     $answer_value =~ tr/\\$@`//d;   #`## make sure student answers can not be interpolated by e.g. EV3
00181     $answer_value =~ s/\s+/ /g;     ## remove excessive whitespace from student answer
00182     
00183     ##########################
00184     # insert a hidden answer blank to hold the applet's state 
00185     # (debug =>1 makes it visible for debugging and provides debugging buttons)
00186     ##########################
00187 
00188 
00189     ##########################
00190     # Regularize the applet's state -- which could be in either XML format or in XML format encoded by base64
00191     # In rare cases it might be simple string -- protect against that by putting xml tags around the state
00192     # The result:
00193     # $base_64_encoded_answer_value -- a base64 encoded xml string
00194     # $decoded_answer_value         -- and xml string
00195     ##########################
00196         
00197     my $base_64_encoded_answer_value;
00198     my $decoded_answer_value;
00199     if ( $answer_value =~/<XML|<?xml/i) {
00200         $base_64_encoded_answer_value = encode_base64($answer_value);
00201         $decoded_answer_value = $answer_value;
00202     } else {
00203         $decoded_answer_value = decode_base64($answer_value);
00204         if ( $decoded_answer_value =~/<XML|<?xml/i) {  # great, we've decoded the answer to obtain an xml string
00205             $base_64_encoded_answer_value = $answer_value;
00206         } else {    #WTF??  apparently we don't have XML tags
00207             $answer_value = "<xml>$answer_value</xml>";
00208             $base_64_encoded_answer_value = encode_base64($answer_value);
00209             $decoded_answer_value = $answer_value;
00210         }
00211     }   
00212     $base_64_encoded_answer_value =~ s/\r|\n//g;    # get rid of line returns
00213 
00214     ##########################
00215     # Construct answer blank for storing state -- in both regular (answer blank hidden) 
00216     # and debug (answer blank displayed) modes.
00217     ##########################
00218     
00219     ##########################
00220     # debug version of the applet state answerBox and controls (all displayed)
00221     # stored in 
00222     # $debug_input_element
00223     ##########################
00224 
00225 #     my $debug_input_element  = qq!\n<textarea  rows="4" cols="80" 
00226 #      name = "$appletStateName" id = "$appletStateName">$decoded_answer_value</textarea><br/>!;
00227 #  conversion to base64 is now being done in the setState module
00228 #  when submitting we want everything to be in the base64 mode for safety
00229     my $debug_input_element  = qq!\n<textarea  rows="4" cols="80" 
00230        name = "$appletStateName" id = "$appletStateName">$answer_value</textarea><br/>!;
00231 
00232     if ($getState=~/\S/) {   # if getStateAlias is not an empty string
00233         $debug_input_element .= qq!
00234             <input type="button"  value="$getState" 
00235                    onClick=" debugText=''; 
00236                              ww_applet_list['$appletName'].getState() ; 
00237                             if (debugText) {alert(debugText)};"
00238             />!;
00239     }
00240     if ($setState=~/\S/) {   # if setStateAlias is not an empty string
00241         $debug_input_element .= qq!
00242             <input type="button"  value="$setState" 
00243                    onClick="debugText='';
00244                             ww_applet_list['$appletName'].setState();
00245                             if (debugText) {alert(debugText)};"
00246             />!;
00247     }
00248     if ($getConfig=~/\S/) {   # if getConfigAlias is not an empty string
00249         $debug_input_element .= qq!
00250             <input type="button"  value="$getConfig" 
00251                    onClick="debugText=''; 
00252                             ww_applet_list['$appletName'].getConfig();
00253                             if (debugText) {alert(debugText)};"
00254             />!;
00255     }
00256     if ($setConfig=~/\S/) {   # if setConfigAlias is not an empty string
00257         $debug_input_element .= qq!
00258             <input type="button"  value="$setConfig" 
00259                    onClick="debugText='';
00260                             ww_applet_list['$appletName'].setConfig();
00261                             if (debugText) {alert(debugText)};"
00262             />!;
00263     }
00264     
00265     ##########################
00266     # Construct answerblank for storing state
00267     # using either the debug version (defined above) or the non-debug version
00268     # where the state variable is hidden and the definition is very simple
00269     # stored in 
00270     # $state_input_element
00271     ##########################
00272             
00273     my $state_input_element = ($debugMode) ? $debug_input_element :
00274           qq!\n<input type="hidden" name = "$appletStateName" id = "$appletStateName"  value ="$base_64_encoded_answer_value">!;
00275           
00276     ##########################
00277     # Construct the reset button string (this is blank if the button is not to be displayed
00278     # $reset_button_str
00279     ##########################
00280 
00281     my $reset_button_str = ($reset_button) ?
00282             qq!<input type='submit' name='previewAnswers' id ='previewAnswers' value='return this question to its initial state' 
00283                  onClick="setHTMLAppletStateToRestart('$appletName')"><br/>!
00284             : ''  ;
00285 
00286     ##########################
00287     # Combine the state_input_button and the reset button into one string
00288     # $state_storage_html_code
00289     ##########################
00290 
00291 
00292     $state_storage_html_code = qq!<input type="hidden"  name="previous_$appletStateName" id = "previous_$appletStateName"  value = "$base_64_encoded_answer_value">!              
00293                               . $state_input_element. $reset_button_str
00294                              ;
00295     ##########################
00296     # Construct the answerBox (if it is requested).  This is a default input box for interacting 
00297     # with the applet.  It is separate from maintaining state but it often contains similar data.
00298     # Additional answer boxes or buttons can be defined but they must be explicitly connected to 
00299     # the applet with additional javaScript commands.
00300     # Result: $answerBox_code
00301     ##########################
00302 
00303     my $answerBox_code ='';
00304     if ($includeAnswerBox) {
00305         if ($debugMode) {
00306         
00307             $answerBox_code = $main::BR . main::NAMED_ANS_RULE('answerBox', 50 );
00308             $answerBox_code .= qq!
00309                              <br/><input type="button" value="get Answer from applet" onClick="eval(ww_applet_list['$appletName'].submitActionScript )"/>
00310                              <br/>
00311                             !;
00312         } else {
00313             $answerBox_code = main::NAMED_HIDDEN_ANS_RULE('answerBox', 50 );
00314         }
00315     }
00316     
00317     ##########################
00318     # insert header material
00319     ##########################
00320     main::HEADER_TEXT($self->insertHeader());
00321     # update the debug mode for this applet.
00322     main::HEADER_TEXT(qq!<script language="javascript"> ww_applet_list["$appletName"].debugMode = $debugMode;\n</script>!);
00323     
00324     ##########################
00325     # Return HTML or TeX strings to be included in the body of the page
00326     ##########################
00327         
00328     return main::MODES(TeX=>' {\bf  applet } ', HTML=>$self->insertObject.$main::BR.$state_storage_html_code.$answerBox_code);
00329 }
00330

00332 
00333 
00334 =cut

00339 
00340 
00341     DOCUMENT();
00342     
00343     # Load whatever macros you need for the problem
00344     loadMacros("PG.pl",
00345                "PGbasicmacros.pl",
00346                "PGchoicemacros.pl",
00347                "PGanswermacros.pl",
00348                "AppletObjects.pl",
00349                "MathObjects.pl",
00350                "source.pl"
00351               );
00352      
00353     ## Do NOT show partial correct answers
00354     $showPartialCorrectAnswers = 0;
00355     
00356     
00357     
00358     ###################################
00359     # Create  link to applet 
00360     ###################################
00361     
00362     $applet = FlashApplet();
00363     my $appletName = "ExternalInterface";
00364     $applet->codebase(findAppletCodebase("$appletName.swf"));
00365     $applet->appletName($appletName);
00366     $applet->appletId($appletName);
00367     
00368     # findAppletCodebase looks for the applet in a list
00369     # of locations specified in global.conf
00370     
00371     ###################################
00372     # Add additional javaScript functions to header section of HTML to 
00373     # communicate with the "ExternalInterface" applet.
00374     ###################################
00375     
00376     $applet->header(<<'END_HEADER');
00377     <script language="javascript" src="https://devel.webwork.rochester.edu:8002/webwork2_files/js/BrowserSniffer.js">
00378     </script>
00379     
00380     
00381     <script language="JavaScript">
00382         function getBrowser() {
00383               //alert("look for sniffer");
00384           var sniffer = new BrowserSniffer();
00385           //alert("found sniffer" +sniffer);
00386           return sniffer;
00387         }
00388     
00389         function updateStatus(sMessage) {
00390               getQE("playbackStatus").value = sMessage;
00391         }
00392         
00393         function newColor() {
00394 
00395           getApplet("ExternalInterface").updateColor(Math.round(Math.random() * 0xFFFFFF));
00396         }
00397         
00398     </script>
00399     END_HEADER
00400     
00401     ###################################
00402     # Configure applet
00403     ###################################
00404     
00405     # not used here.  Allows for uploading an xml string for the applet
00406     
00407     
00408     
00409     
00410     ###################################
00411     # write the text for the problem
00412     ###################################
00413     
00414     TEXT(beginproblem());
00415     
00416     
00417      
00418     BEGIN_TEXT
00419     \{ $applet->insertAll() \}
00420       $PAR
00421     
00422       The Flash object operates above this line.  The box and button below this line are part of 
00423       the WeBWorK problem.  They communicate with the Flash object.
00424       $HR
00425       Status <input type="text" id="playbackStatus" value="started" /><br />
00426       Color <input type="button" value="new color" name="newColorButton" onClick="newColor()" />
00427        $PAR $HR
00428        This flash applet was created by Barbara Kaskosz. 
00429     
00430     END_TEXT
00431     
00432     ENDDOCUMENT();
